title.value: Timeliness of reporting of SARS-CoV-2 seroprevalence results and their utility for infectious disease surveillance
title.justification: This is the title of the paper as it appears on the first page, providing a clear indication of the research focuses on the speed of reporting seroprevalence data for COVID-19 and its importance for public health surveillance.
title.quote: Timeliness of reporting of SARS-CoV-2 seroprevalence results and their utility for infectious disease surveillance

extractions.description: The paper investigates how quickly SARS-CoV-2 seroprevalence results are reported by different publication platforms and how this impacts public health surveillance. It analyzes data from seroprevalence studies conducted between January 1, 2020 to December 31, 2021, focuses on timeliness of publication, validity, and representativeness, and provides recommendations for improving serosurveillance efforts. It further suggests the development of a global data repository for rapid dissemination for use in public health policy and responses.

type.justification: The study conducted data analysis, using seroprevalence data from various publications and examining actual timeliness of reporting and its impact on public health surveillance.
type.quote: We analyzed 1844 studies. Median time to publication was 154 days (IQR 64â€“255), varying by publication venue...

name.justification: The research contributes to understanding the effectiveness of surveillance on the spread and immunity of COVID-19 by examining the timeliness and usefulness of seroprevalence studies in surveillance systems.
name.quote: Seroprevalence studies have been used throughout the COVID-19 pandemic to monitor infection and immunity.

name.justification: The paper analyzes seroprevalence which is a key component of epidemiological studies during the COVID-19 pandemic.
name.quote: Timely information about population immunity can be critical for effective public health decision-making, as emphasized throughout the COVID-19 pandemic.

name.justification: The paper describes using the SeroTracker database for systematically reviewing seroprevalence studies.
name.quote: We identified SARS-CoV-2 seroprevalence studies using a living systematic review registered with PROSPERO (CRD42020183634) (Arora et al., 2021). Data sources and searching methods have been previously described (Bobrovitz et al., 2021).

referenced_paper_title.value: SeroTracker: a global SARS-CoV-2 seroprevalence dashboard
referenced_paper_title.justification: The referenced paper details SeroTracker, which is cited as the data source for the research analysis.
referenced_paper_title.quote: SeroTracker: a global SARS-CoV-2 seroprevalence dashboard.

name.justification: The paper references using the "survminer" library for statistical analysis in R, particularly for Kaplan-Meier plots.
name.quote: Analysis was completed using the survminer library and ggsurvplot function in R (Version 4.0.5).

referenced_paper_title.justification: There is no specific paper referenced for the survminer library, as it refers to the tool/software used for analysis within the research.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Analysis was completed using the survminer library and ggsurvplot function in R (Version 4.0.5).
